oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Black Jack Wayne Show - 1960-05-14 - KTVU
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Audio portion of an episode of the Black Jack Wayne Show from May 14, 1960 on television station KTVU-TV (Oakland, Calif.) Featuring Black Jack Wayne (host, performer), the Maddox Brothers and Rose (performers), Shorty Bacon (performer), Chuck Wayne (performer), Lefty Frizzell (performer), Rockin' Jerry Hill (performer), Fred Lewis (performer), Bill Carter (performer), and Roy Hammer (performer). Show band includes Verne Orr (bass), Fred Lewis (guitar), Sam Davis (guitar), Marty James (fiddle), and Roy Hammer (performer).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Black Jack Wayne; Maddox Brothers and Rose; Shorty Bacon; Lonzo and Oscar; Chuck Wayne; Lefty Frizzell; Rockin' Jerry Hill; Fred Lewis; Bill Carter; Roy Hammer
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Test tones -- Opening theme -- Opening statement -- Black Jack Wayne talks and introduces the Maddox Brothers and Rose -- Down, Down, Down (Maddox Brothers and Rose) -- Black Jack Wayne talks and introduces Shorty Bacon -- Sparkling Brown Eyes (Shorty Bacon, Maddox Brothers) -- Black Jack Wayne talks and introduces Lonzo and Oscar -- Lonzo and Oscar talk and introduce the next tune -- Skunk Skin Britches (Lonzo and Oscar) -- Furniture Warehouse commercial -- Black Jack Wayne talks and promotes his new single -- Chuck Wayne introduces the next tune -- Just One Time (Chuck Wayne) -- Black Jack Wayne talks and promotes an upcoming live show -- Black Jack Wayne introduces the next tune -- Scoundrels And Saints (Black Jack Wayne, Rose Maddox) -- Black Jack Wayne talks and introduces Lefty Frizzell -- Frizzell talks and introduces the next tune -- Old Heart She's Gone (Lefty Frizzell) -- Furniture Warehouse commercial -- Slippin' And Slidin' (Rockin' Jerry Hill) -- Lips That Kiss So Sweetly (Fred Lewis, Bill Carter, Roy Hammer) -- Closing statement -- Closing theme --
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Maddox Brothers & Rose; Wayne, Chuck; Frizzell, Lefty, 1928-1975; KTVU-TV (Television station : Oakland, Calif.)
